newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai T-bill repo rates ends down, spot up.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai T-bill repo rates ends down, spot up.

text.p: Contracts on the treasury bill repurchase market in Shanghai closed mostly down on Friday with institutions reducing their business on market uncertainties ahead of the weekend, traders said.
The most active three-day contract plunged to 2.59 percent from 13.50 percent on Thursday.
Total turnover fell to 3.58 million lots from 5.99 million. One lot is 1,000 yuan face value of treasury bills.
Traders said institutions believed that there would be a major technical rebound on the domestic A share markets next week and that this dampend sentiment on the repo market.
